intro: Clinopodium clinopodium, commonly known as wild thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale pink to white flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Clinopodium clinopodium is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, and it is valued for its medicinal and culinary uses.
